title: corpo atelier stacks five terraces and a garden on lush golf course
text:
corpo atelier stacks five terraces and a garden on lush golf course jan 29, 2017 corpo atelier stacks five terraces and a garden on lush golf course 


situated on a golf course in vilamoura on the southern coast of portugal , local practice corpo atelier completes the house aptly titled ‘five terraces and a garden’. the particular landscape features expanses of open space with view obstructions lending to the function of a golf course, with scattered single family residences forming an informal perimeter around the holes. at ground level, a vibrantly green landscape dotted with generally low shrubs and trees is only challenged by the view from upper levels revealing the ocean to the south and the mountains to the north. 
image © ricardo oliveira alves (also first image) 


as the name implies, corpo atelier took these two visual queues to create a home composed of five stacked and cantilevered terraces that respond simultaneously to the desired exterior views and interior privacy from neighboring homes and golfers. each stark white block features an opaque outer wall that conceals the opening inside, forming voids for balconies and planters, allowing light and ventilation to the interior while blocking views from ground level. each level provides a different landscape of views as one gradually escalated to the top level, meanwhile terraces housing plants are elevated along the structure providing pockets of greenery throughout the house. the interior continues the white palette typical of the area- reflective tiled floors help reflect light to all rooms and stay cooler in the summer days making the interior a pleasant environment. 
each terrace provides privacy and nooks for gardens and balconies 


‘the terrace was the prodigy of the house, in it the wind passed. I had started to discover the body and had the light for confident.’ – eugenio de andrade; white in white against obscurity
